result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan Daniel Halfmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered.

records.addlTxt: Relay Sheet / Proof of Submission / DNA at Conviction

9:02 AM - case called.  Defendant Ethan Daniel Halfmann in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding plea agreement.  Right to counsel.  Responses by Defendant.  Court finds waiver of an attorney is free and voluntary.  Plea to Count 1 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Statement by Atty Polzin/Court regarding sentencing.  Court orders a fine in the amount of $300.00 plus cc/sc to be paid in 60 days unless payment arraignments are made with the Court.  Post conviction rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on May 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:54 PM - case called.  Defendant Ethan Daniel Halfmann appeared in court.  Attorney Kurt Zengler for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the Defendant.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.
